clinical_study.brief_title: A Study on Brain Activity During Transcranial Direct Current Stimulation in Stroke Patients
clinical_study.official_title: A Study on Brain Activity During Transcranial Direct Current Stimulation for Improving Finger-Hand Function in Stroke Patients

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to identify the characteristics of neural plasticity seen in stroke patients by measuring the changes in brain activity during stimulation using functional near-infrared spectroscopy (fNIRS) when applying transcranial direct current stimulation (tDCS) for the purpose of enhancing finger function.

primary_outcome.measure: Changes in cortical activity using fNIRS signals during brain stimulation
primary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline and about 10 days (immediately after brain stimulation sessions)
primary_outcome.description: Cortical activities before and after brain stimulation sessions are compared.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline and about 10 days (immediately after brain stimulation sessions)
secondary_outcome.description: Resting motor threshold (rMT) and amplitude of motor evoked potential in first dorsal interosseous muscle are measured. These outcomes are measured by transcranial magnetic stimulation over the motor hotspot. The rMT is defined as the minimum stimulus intensity that produced a minimal motor evoked response at rest. The amplitude means peak to peak of the muscle response.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline and about 10 days (immediately after brain stimulation sessions)
secondary_outcome.description: The test is a standardized, quantitative assessment used to measure finger dexterity of a patient.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline and about 10 days (immediately after brain stimulation sessions)
secondary_outcome.description: The test is to measure the maximum isometric strength of hand, forearm, and finger muscles.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline and about 10 days (immediately after brain stimulation sessions)
secondary_outcome.description: The test is used to measure the gross manual dexterity of a patient, or of a person using an upper limb prosthetic device.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline and about 10 days (immediately after brain stimulation sessions)
secondary_outcome.description: The score is a stroke-specific, performance-based impairment index. The degree of impairment of upper and lower limbs is measured.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline and about 10 days (immediately after brain stimulation sessions)
secondary_outcome.description: Response time is measured during finger tapping task.

arm_group.description: Patients receive four sessions of tDCS stimulation over C3 (patient with left-sided lesion) or C4 (patient with right-sided lesion) based on 10-20 system.

intervention.description: Four sessions of stimulation over C3 (patient with left-sided lesion) or C4 (patient with right-sided lesion) based on 10-20 system

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Unilateral stroke patients
- Chronic patients over 6 months after onset
- Subcortical stroke
- Patients with the movement of fingers
Exclusion Criteria:
- History of psychiatric disease
- Significant other neurological diseases except for stroke
- Difficult to perform this experiment
- Patients with metal implants
- History of epilepsy
- Pregnancy
- Skin defect at the site of electrode attachment
